roleset.name: allow
roleset.note: LET-V NOTES: DO NOT TAG this discourse-level "let alone" (John can't remember hisown name, let alone anyone else's). (from let.01-v)

example.name: allowed S
example.text: Sony won't let a young short-term American employee take on any responsibility.
example.arg: a young short-term American employee take on any responsibility.

example.name: allowed NP, really a shortening of allowed S
example.text: They wanted to roll the dice and we-1're going *trace*-1 to let them.

roleset.name: to rent or lease
roleset.note: LET-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, Part 04. No relevant VN, FN entry for this sense. Comparison to rent.02: be a landlord. Framed by Claire. (from let.05-v)

roles.note: No examples with term found for "let," seems possible but perhaps this is a difference from "rent." (from let.05-v)

example.name: Args 0, 1, 2, 3
example.text: For the next hour or so he told me that the Vigilant has been around since 1911 when they let rooms to mostly sailors and soldiers for five cents a night, doing a banner business between the World Wars.
example.arg: doing a banner business between the World Wars.

example.name: typical usage
example.text: The CIA was more interested than they let on to Mr. Stoll.

example.name: with explicit indication
example.text: John never let on to Mary that he was secretly a Martian.
example.arg: that he was secretly a Martian

example.name: take it easy, already
example.text: Ms. Browning says she believes a recapitalization involving employee ownership would succeed only if the pilots let up on their demand for control.

roleset.name: disappoint
roleset.note: LET_DOWN-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in ectb revisions. Framed by Claire. (from let.04-v)

example.name: Inanimate disappointed entity
example.text: While delivering his appreciation speech , Xiaotong Fei said that " I will never let down the encouragement given to me by this friendly neighboring country .
example.arg: the encouragement given to me by this friendly neighboring country

roleset.name: rent or lease
roleset.note: LET_OUT-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, Part04. No relevant entry in VN, FN. Phrasal version of let.05. Framed by Claire. (from let.06-v)

example.name: Args 0, 1
example.text: We initially lived in the property but subsequently let it out having received permission to do so from Nationwide .
example.arg: having received permission to do so from Nationwide .
